sources.citation: Cook, Jessica L. 2017. "Geography of a Massacre: Cherokee and Carolinian Visions of Land at Long Cane." Charlottesville: University of Virginia.
De Vorsey, Louis. 1966. The Indian Boundary in the Southern Colonies, 1763-1775. Chapel Hill: University of North Carolina Press.
Gragson, Ted L., and Paul V. Bolstad. "A Local Analysis of Early-Eighteenth-Century Cherokee Settlement." Social Science History 31, no. 3 (2007): 435-68.
Hewatt, Alexander. 1779. An Historical Account Of The Rise And Progress Of The Colonies Of South Carolina And Georgia. Vol. 1. London: Alexander Donaldson.
Mooney, James. 1975 [1900]. Historical Sketch of the Cherokee. Chicago: Aldine.

Royce, Charles C. 1881. "Cessions of land by Indian tribes to the United States: Illustrated by those in the State of Indiana." First annual report of the Bureau of Ethnology to the Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, 1879-80: 247-262. Washington: Government Printing Office.
Royce, Charles. C. 1884. "Map of the former territorial limits of the Cherokee "Nation of" Indians ; Map showing the territory originally assigned Cherokee "Nation of" Indians." S.l. Map.

Royce, Charles C. 1887. "The Cherokee Nation of Indians: A Narrative of Their Official Relations with the Colonial and Federal Governments." Fifth Annual Report of the Bureau of Ethnology to the Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, 1883—84: 121—378. Washington: Government Printing Office.

Royce, Charles C. 1899. "Indian land cessions in the United States, compiled by Charles C. Royce, with an introduction by Cyrus Thomas." Eighteenth Annual Report of the Bureau of Ethnology to the Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution, 1896–97: 521–964. Washington: Government Printing Office.
Thornton, Russell. The Cherokees: A population history. U of Nebraska Press, 1990.
